title: 820-3662-a
message:
MacBook Pro A1398 stuck on Apple logo with  trackpad flex. Replacing the trackpad and tape does not help. Only turns on without trackpad flex in the motherboard - J4800. I did a pram and SMC reset. Please help.

PP5V_S5_CUMULUS - 5v
PP3V3_TPAD_CONN 3v
R4800 and R4808 are ok

title: 820-3662-a
message: I can't unless I take out the flex.  I can try without

title: 820-3662-a
message:
You can't start ASD at all?
Can you access boot menu at least?
Disconnect keyboard, let only trackpad connected.

title: 820-3662-a
message:
I can't run ASD with trackpad flex.
I can't access boot menu.
With the keyboard disconnected MacBook stuck on Apple logo.

title: 820-3662-a
message: Check all resistors related with trackpad connector.

title: 820-3662-a
message: Compare diode mode readings on trackpad connector with good board.

title: 820-3662-a
message:
Diode mode shows no differences.
Test ASD stuck on CPU test.
Hear a jammed chime during startup with trackpad flex.

title: 820-3662-a
message:
Check SMC_LID and BUTTON_DISABLE, w/ and w/o TP connected.
R4802 is good?

title: 820-3662-a
message: I noticed now that it turns on normally without a battery.

title: 820-3662-a
message: Then put a known good battery.

title: 820-3662-a
message: With a new good battery still the same.

title: 820-3662-a
message:
Can you start in SMC bypass with both charger and battery connected?
The "new" battery was tested in other machine?

title: 820-3662-a
message:
SMC bypass does not help.
The battery is tested and operational.
MacBook with battery loops startup sound. 
Only disconnecting the battery or the trackpad flex helps.

title: 820-3662-a
message: So it turns on with battery, but trackpad disconneted?

title: 820-3662-a
message: Yes or turns on with trackpad, but battery disconneted.

title: 820-3662-a
message:
I still doubt about battery.
Run ASD in both scenarios...

title: 820-3662-a
message:
I tested on 3 different batteries. 
I noticed that PPBUS_G3H without battery has 12.56v and with about 11v. - on three different batteries
